oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Senator Sam Houston of Texas, Mrs. Houston and Sam, Jr., at the deathbed of Andrew Jackson, June 9, 1845
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A group of mourners, which include Sam Houston, his wife, and his son, surround the deathbed of former President Andrew Jackson. Two lit candles can be seen next to his bed.

Andrew Jackson died in 1845 while living at his home in Hermitage, Tennessee, after suffering from an extended period of declining health. He was 78. Two days after his death, he was buried in the Hermitage garden. Jackson and Houston had long been acquainted; Houston had been a staunch supporter of Andrew Jackson during the 1820s.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; United States presidents; Houston, Sam, 1793-1863
